title: Designing super-fast trimodal sponges using recycled polypropylene for organics cleanup | Scientific Reports - Nature.com
summary: This article describes a new method of creating porous polymer thin films that can be used to selectively sorb oil from water. The method involves using a combination of preheating, rotation, and a cavity forming agent to create a trimodal structure with cavities, macro-voids, and micropores. The resulting sorbent films have a high porosity and tensile strength, and they can absorb up to 97 g/g of oil. They are also reusable and can be recycled using both mechanical squeezing and solvent washing techniques.

title: Trützschler and Balkan join forces for textile recycling - The Textile Magazine

title: Celebrating 75 Years of the Very Best Kiwi Farming - MiNDFOOD
summary: Silver Fern Farms, a New Zealand-based meat company, is celebrating its 75th anniversary.
